questions.question: Which of the following is not a reading question?

choices.answer: True/False
Factual
Inference
Vocabulary

questions.question: I have to read the whole text to respond the questions

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What is the most appropiate strategy for vocabulary questions?

choices.answer: Read the whole paragraph  and then look for synonyms
Read the whole text to understand the meaning
Select one of the options at random
Read the line where the word is and attempt to analyze the context

questions.question: What is the most appropiate strategy for heading matching questions?

choices.answer: Read the whole paragraph and get the main idea
Read the first line and the last line  to get the heading
Read the the whole text to get the possible heading
Read the first two paragraphs and the last two to get the heading

questions.question: How many words does a text of level 6 have?

choices.answer: Betweem 700 and 800 words
Between 400 and 500 words
Between 500 and 600 words
Between 900 and 1000 words

questions.question: What is the most appropiate strategy for inference questions?

choices.answer: Read the whole paragraph and then get the main idea
Focus on key words and then read the whole paragraph
Read the whole text and then select the most appropiate option
Read the highlighted part only, and select the option that best fit
True
False

questions.question: What is the most appropiate strategy for factual questions?

choices.answer: Read the whole text and analyze possible key words
Scan the whole text and search possible key words
Scan possible key words on the paragraph and look for specific information
Scan the options and make possible comparisons with the text.
True
False

questions.question: The main idea question is normally the last question

choices.answer: True
False
